title: Boy dies after being shot with pellet gun
content:
A 12-year old McAlester boy died in Tulsa on Saturday after he was shot once in the head by a pellet gun Friday night during a sleep-over with a friend in Bache, said Pittsburg County Sheriff Joel Kerns.
Justin Ingle died at St. Francis Hospital in Tulsa, the sheriff said. He had initially been transported to the McAlester Regional Health Center following the shooting, then transported by medical flight to the Tulsa hospital, according to the sheriff.
An investigation into the shooting is still open, but Kerns said that based on preliminary findings, it appears the shooting was an accident.
“Supposedly, the boys were playing with a high-powered pellet gun and one was shot in the temple,” Kerns said.
Law enforcement officers aren’t releasing the name of the individual allegedly holding the weapon when the shot was fired because that person is a juvenile, the sheriff said.
Following completion of the investigation, a report will be turned over to the District 18 District Attorney’s office, said Kerns.
